message.content:
1. During surgery, group I received more fluid than group C.
2. The amount of fluid received by group I was 4,618 ± 1,557 ml.
3. The amount of fluid received by group C was 1,694 ± 705 ml.
4. The difference in fluid received by group I and group C was statistically significant (P < 0.0001).
5. ΔPP decreased from 22 ± 75 to 9 ± 1% in group I.
6. The decrease in ΔPP in group I was statistically significant (P < 0.05).
7. The median duration of postoperative stay in hospital was lower in group I than in group C.
8. The median duration of postoperative stay in hospital was 7 days for group I.
9. The median duration of postoperative stay in hospital was 17 days for group C.
10. The difference in the median duration of postoperative stay in hospital between group I and group C was statistically significant (P < 0.01).
11. The number of postoperative complications per patient was lower in group I than in group C.
12. The number of postoperative complications per patient was 1.4 ± 2.1 for group I.
13. The number of postoperative complications per patient was 3.9 ± 2.8 for group C.
14. The difference in the number of postoperative complications per patient between group I and group C was statistically significant (P < 0.05).
15. The median duration of mechanical ventilation was lower in group I than in group C.
16. The median duration of mechanical ventilation was 1 day for group I.
17. The median duration of mechanical ventilation was 5 days for group C.
18. The difference in the median duration of mechanical ventilation between group I and group C was statistically significant (P < 0.05).
19. The median duration of stay in the intensive care unit was lower in group I than in group C.
20. The median duration of stay in the intensive care unit was 3 days for group I.
21. The median duration of stay in the intensive care unit was 9 days for group C.
22. The difference in the median duration of stay in the intensive care unit between group I and group C was statistically significant (P < 0.01).

messages.content:
Statement: During surgery, group I received more fluid than group C (4,618 ± 1,557 versus 1,694 ± 705 ml (mean ± SD), P < 0.0001), and ΔPP decreased from 22 ± 75 to 9 ± 1% (P < 0.05) in group I. The median duration of postoperative stay in hospital (7 versus 17 days, P < 0.01) was lower in group I than in group C. The number of postoperative complications per patient (1.4 ± 2.1 versus 3.9 ± 2.8, P < 0.05), as well as the median duration of mechanical ventilation (1 versus 5 days, P < 0.05) and stay in the intensive care unit (3 versus 9 days, P < 0.01) was also lower in group I.

CONCLUSION.

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
